column4: the cups web interface, or printer config tools have a checkbox to allow/share the printers
you may want to be sure samba is working if its shareing to a windows machine
I would like to edit /etc/cups/cupsd.conf to allow one specific other host to print via my computer
i belive the web interface gives you a gui for doing that. i never limit my home lan that way
Let me give you the full picture...
We have a local network with one Ubuntu machine that is connected to the external network.
That same machine is also connected (via wireless) to some printers on the local network
Now, I would like to allow a specific machine on the external network (static ip) to submit printjobs via lpr to the Ubuntu server
could do a ssh tunnle. Im not sure how cups security features would work across the internets. Never needed that feature
SSH port forwarding sounds like an interesting idea
cups may have some features to do that allready. but ive never used them. check the cups.org homepage/docs perhaps. or askubuntu.com
So I would set up a tunnel from some local port on the webserver, to the print servers port 631. Then I would run lpr towards my local port. Would CUPS allow that?
Ok. Thanks for your help, I will try with port forwarding.
I've read quite a bit of CUPS documentation, and it is indeed not very nice to printing newbies

you are doing somthing complex.. and cups Is a 'business class' tool. for local/home ussage my cups machines all see eatch other and  getting printing going is just a few clicks.. or even less at times
